Articles.Content: Sorry for Asking Lol

Admittedly, some people may realize there is a difference between 1.0 and 1.0.2 and some of us may not know enough about the changes between the two to assume what works in 1.0 will do so in 1.0.2 So I say give the guy the benefit of the doubt.

Tested it with the workaround in 1.0.2 and it works just as intended.

Deployed

With Porkjets friendly permission, heres a workaround for all people that donÃ‚Â´t want to try to fix it themselfs

Any reason why you don't have TechTree integration?

Here's my config for the techtree, if you want to add it into your MM config package:

@PART[baseMount]

{

@TechRequired = advMetalworks

@description = The low profile base mount for all of your low profile base mounting needs!

}

@PART[centrifuge1]:NEEDS[!CommunityTechTree]

{

@TechRequired = metaMaterials

@title = ILS-1 Habitat Centrifuge

@entryCost = 30000

@cost = 12500

}

@PART[centrifuge1]:NEEDS[CommunityTechTree]

{

@TechRequired = offworldManufacturing

@title = ILS-1 Habitat Centrifuge

@entryCost = 30000

@cost = 12500

}

@PART[inflato1]

{

@TechRequired = metaMaterials

@entryCost = 20000

@cost = 8500

}

@PART[inflato2]

{

@TechRequired = composites

@entryCost = 12500

@cost = 5000

}

@PART[inflatoFlat]

{

@TechRequired = metaMaterials

@entryCost = 25000

@cost = 10000

}

@PART[orbitalorb]

{

@TechRequired = commandModules

@entryCost = 5400

@cost = 1600

}

Edited May 25, 2015 by Selentic
Looks wonderful, thanks for the fix! I take it there are no IVA's for these modules?

Looks wonderful, thanks for the fix! I take it there are no IVA's for these modules?

The Orb has a great one! With RPM support, even. The others are more bare-bones, but the FLAT is the only part that is missing its IVA. (Though you can always use the Inflato2's.)
Even with RPM? That's lovely! Added to my tech tree and looking forward to using them.^^

Any reason why you don't have TechTree integration?

I was wrong, it already is part of the techtree...

Lazieness
Love this mod! Should we expect more parts in the future?
wait, what about these don't work in 1.0.2? I've been using it directly from CKAN and, as far as I can tell, they've been working just fine...

wait, what about these don't work in 1.0.2? I've been using it directly from CKAN and, as far as I can tell, they've been working just fine...

Making a proper update is always better. Since this hasn't been updated since 0.23.5 (almost a year ago, if not more!), there are probably a lot of code errors that might enhance the mod even more. Porkjet could you please update this (and your other outdated mods) to work with the latest update? Your mods are probably of highest standard, as they look very stock-alike and have very great functions.
I can confirm that the parts work fine, except for the orb command module. There's no way to attach anything using the lower node.

Looking at the configs, all parts have an inverted "node_stack_bottom" normal:

In ALL .cfgs, juts change the value highlighted red:

node_stack_bottom = 0.0, xxxx, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 2

to:

node_stack_bottom = 0.0, xxxx, 0.0, 0.0, -1.0, 0.0, 2

This will allow attachment to the lower node.

Looking at the configs, all parts have an inverted "node_stack_bottom" normal:

In ALL .cfgs, juts change the value highlighted red:

node_stack_bottom = 0.0, xxxx, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 2

to:

node_stack_bottom = 0.0, xxxx, 0.0, 0.0, -1.0, 0.0, 2

This will allow attachment to the lower node.

look a few posts back. someone already posted a fix for it.

look a few posts back. someone already posted a fix for it.

And there's the problem with not having an official update. Not criticizing, just saying that's just not as nice or complete as a simple update to the package (with bugfixes) would be, especially for noobies who only came in at 1.0

Don't tell it to me, I'm just another player (and modder with other mods) who's nice enough to stop in and either help with solutions or point people at other solutions (which all too often happen to appear on the very page their plaintive cry for help appears on that they would have seen if they'd taken a moment to glance at the last page or two)
can you update it to 1.0
These are so cool. It would be nice if it were updated
Porkjet, come on! This parts pack doesn't deserve it to die! I really want to use these, (I know, it works with 1.0.2) but it may cause bugs and the memory size is just too big.
License prevents people from creating an updated fork, so we just have to wait for Porkjet to take an interest in this mod again.

Porkjet, come on! This parts pack doesn't deserve it to die! I really want to use these, (I know, it works with 1.0.2) but it may cause bugs and the memory size is just too big.

You're worrying too much if you think it is going to cause bugs... use the fixes that people have posted here and you'll be fine.

I've tried using this mod in 1.0.2 with the Caretaker Files (And yes, I've got the original files as well as the caretaker ones so I have all the necessary files) and the parts don't seem to appear. Every time I try to use Alt+F12 to recompile the parts, It says something along the lines of "Unable to Compile part" for all the Habitat Pack parts. Anyone know a workaround for this issue?
Good news, guys! I pm'd Porkjet and asked about it, he said he's working on a complete overhaul for this ! I'm very excited to see that.
Outstanding, lets hope Squad see the light and let him revue all space station parts.

Outstanding, lets hope Squad see the light and let him revue all space station parts.

I've broached the topic before and there's some question as to whether there's a real need for inflatables so it doesn't seem likely to happen.

Every time I try to use Alt+F12 to recompile the parts, It says something along the lines of "Unable to Compile part" for all the Habitat Pack parts. Anyone know a workaround for this issue?

Post an output_log.txt (or player.log if Linux/Mac). I'll take a look at it and see what's happening.
